title: 108_s553
content: The "Business Checking Freedom Act of 2003" authorizes interest-bearing transaction accounts for all businesses. The "Business Checking Freedom Act of 2003" allows depository institutions to permit up to 24 transfers per month for interest-bearing accounts, as specified in Public Law 93-100. The "Business Checking Freedom Act of 2003" allows depository institutions to permit transfers between accounts within the same institution, subject to Federal Reserve rules. SEC. 3. PAYMENT OF INTEREST ON RESERVES AT FEDERAL RESERVE BANKS. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow depository institutions to earn interest on balances maintained at a Federal Reserve bank, to be paid quarterly at rates not exceeding short-term interest rates, with regulations set by the Board. The Board may prescribe regulations regarding the payment and distribution of earnings to depository institutions maintaining balances at Federal Reserve banks. The Board may prescribe regulations for the payment and distribution of earnings to depository institutions maintaining balances at Federal Reserve banks, including the responsibilities of various entities for crediting and distributing earnings. The Federal Reserve bank defines depository institutions to include trust companies, corporations organized under section 25A, branches or agencies of foreign banks. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to include authorization for pass-through reserves for member banks and make technical and conforming amendments. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to include authorization for pass-through reserves for member banks and make technical and conforming amendments, including redesignating subparagraphs and updating subsection references. SEC. 4 amends the Federal Reserve Act to increase flexibility in setting reserve requirements. It allows for a ratio not greater than 3 percent (which may be zero) and not less than 8 percent (which may be zero). SEC. 5 involves the transfer of Federal Reserve surpluses. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow additional transfers from surplus funds to cover interest payments for fiscal years 2003 through 2007. The Federal Reserve Act is amended to allow transfers from surplus funds to cover interest payments for fiscal years 2003 through 2007, with the Secretary of the Treasury depositing necessary sums in the general fund of the Treasury. The Federal Reserve Board will allocate the total amount required to be paid by the Federal Reserve banks for these fiscal years, determining the amount each bank shall pay. No replenishment of surplus funds is allowed during this period. During fiscal years 2003 through 2007, Federal Reserve banks are prohibited from replenishing their surplus funds by the amount of any transfer made to cover interest payments. Any excess amount in the surplus fund exceeding 3 percent of the total must be paid to the Treasury during this period. During fiscal years 2003 through 2007, any excess amount in the surplus fund of a Federal Reserve bank exceeding 3 percent of the total must be transferred to the Secretary of the Treasury for deposit in the general fund.
